quiz.title: Spatial Reasoning Beginner to Intermediate Quiz

questions.text: A square is rotated 90 degrees clockwise. Which corner of the original square is now in the top-left position?
questions.explanation: In a 90-degree clockwise rotation, the top-left corner moves to the top-right, the top-right to the bottom-right, and so on. Thus, the original top-right corner is now in the top-left position.

questions.text: A cube has faces numbered 1 to 6. If face 1 is on top and face 2 is on the front, which face is on the bottom?
questions.explanation: In a standard cube, the face opposite the top (face 1) is the bottom. If faces are numbered 1 to 6, the opposite of face 1 is face 6, so face 6 is on the bottom.

questions.text: A 3x3 grid has a missing cell in the bottom-right corner. If the pattern alternates between black and white cells starting with black in the top-left, what color is the missing cell?
questions.explanation: The 3x3 grid alternates colors: top row (black, white, black), middle row (white, black, white), bottom row (black, white, ?). The pattern continues, so the bottom-right cell is black.

questions.text: If a triangle is reflected over its vertical axis, what happens to its leftmost vertex?
questions.explanation: Reflecting a triangle over its vertical axis swaps left and right sides. Thus, the leftmost vertex becomes the rightmost vertex.

questions.text: A flat square sheet is folded in half vertically and then in half horizontally. What shape is the result?
questions.explanation: Folding a square vertically creates a rectangle, and folding that rectangle horizontally results in a smaller square, as both dimensions are halved.

questions.text: Which shape completes the pattern: circle, square, triangle, circle, square, __?
questions.explanation: The pattern repeats every three shapes: circle, square, triangle. After circle, square, the next shape is triangle.

questions.text: A cube is painted red on all faces and cut into 8 smaller cubes. How many smaller cubes have exactly three faces painted red?
questions.explanation: A 2x2x2 cube (8 smaller cubes) has each corner cube with three faces painted. There are 8 corners, so all 8 smaller cubes have three faces painted red.

questions.text: If a rectangle is rotated 180 degrees, what happens to its top-left corner?
questions.explanation: A 180-degree rotation flips the rectangle, moving the top-left corner to the bottom-right position.

questions.text: In a 4x4 grid, the top row has 4 stars, the second row has 3 stars, the third row has 2 stars, and the fourth row has 1 star. How many stars are in the grid?
questions.explanation: Sum the stars: 4 (first row) + 3 (second row) + 2 (third row) + 1 (fourth row) = 10 stars.

questions.text: A flat piece of paper in the shape of a cross is folded to form a cube. Which face of the cube is opposite the center of the cross?

options.text: The face formed by one of the cross arms
The face formed by the center of the cross
The face opposite the center of the cross

questions.explanation: In a cross-shaped net for a cube, the center square forms one face, and the opposite face is formed by the square opposite the center in the folded cube.

questions.text: A 3x3 grid has numbers 1 to 9 in a spiral pattern starting from the top-left and moving clockwise inward. What number is in the center?
questions.explanation: The spiral pattern is: 1, 2, 3, 8, 9, 4, 7, 6, 5. The center of the 3x3 grid is 5.

questions.text: If a triangle is rotated 120 degrees clockwise, what happens to its vertices?

options.text: They remain in the same positions

questions.explanation: A 120-degree clockwise rotation of a triangle moves each vertex to the position of the next vertex in a clockwise direction.

questions.text: A cube has a blue dot on one face. If the cube is rolled forward once and then right once, where is the blue dot?
questions.explanation: Rolling forward moves the dot to an adjacent face, and rolling right moves it to another side face, keeping it on a side face.

questions.text: Which shape completes the pattern: square, circle, square, circle, square, __?
questions.explanation: The pattern alternates between square and circle. After square, the next shape is circle.

questions.text: A flat sheet is folded into a triangular pyramid (tetrahedron). How many faces does the resulting shape have?
questions.explanation: A tetrahedron has 4 triangular faces, formed by folding a net with 4 triangles.

questions.text: A 2x2 grid has a black top-left cell, white top-right, white bottom-left, and a missing bottom-right cell. What color completes the pattern?
questions.explanation: The pattern alternates colors diagonally: black (top-left) and white (top-right), white (bottom-left) and black (bottom-right).

questions.text: If a cube is cut into 27 smaller cubes (3x3x3), how many smaller cubes have at least one face exposed?
questions.explanation: In a 3x3x3 cube, only the center cube (1 cube) has no exposed faces. Thus, 27 - 1 = 26 cubes have at least one face exposed.

questions.text: A square is divided into four equal triangles. How many lines are drawn to create these triangles?
questions.explanation: Drawing the two diagonals of a square divides it into four equal triangles, requiring 2 lines.

questions.text: If a pentagon is rotated 72 degrees clockwise, what happens to its vertices?
questions.explanation: A pentagon has 5 vertices, and a 72-degree rotation (360 ÷ 5) moves each vertex to the next position clockwise.

questions.text: A 3x3 grid has a pattern where the first column is red, the second column is blue, and the third column is green. What color is the cell in the second row, third column?
questions.explanation: The third column is green, so the cell in the second row, third column is green.

questions.text: A cube has a red face on top and a blue face on the front. If it is rolled left once, what color is on top?

options.text: The color of the original right face
The color of the original bottom face

questions.explanation: Rolling left moves the right face to the top, the top to the left, and so on. Thus, the original right face’s color is now on top.

questions.text: Which shape completes the pattern: triangle, square, pentagon, triangle, square, __?
questions.explanation: The pattern repeats every three shapes: triangle, square, pentagon. After triangle, square, the next is pentagon.

questions.text: A flat rectangular sheet is folded in half along its longer side. What is the shape of the resulting figure?
questions.explanation: Folding a rectangle along its longer side halves the longer dimension, resulting in a narrower rectangle.

questions.text: A 3x3 grid has a diagonal pattern of stars from top-left to bottom-right. How many stars are in the grid?
questions.explanation: The diagonal from top-left to bottom-right includes cells (1,1), (2,2), (3,3), so there are 3 stars.

questions.text: If a cube is painted blue on one face and rolled twice forward, where is the blue face?
questions.explanation: Two forward rolls return the cube to its original orientation, with the blue face (originally on top) back on the bottom.

questions.text: A square is divided into 9 equal smaller squares (3x3 grid). If the center square is shaded, how many smaller squares share an edge with it?
questions.explanation: The center square in a 3x3 grid shares edges with the squares above, below, left, and right, totaling 4 squares.

questions.text: A flat net of a cube has 6 squares in a cross shape. If the center square is red, which square is opposite it when folded into a cube?

options.text: The top arm of the cross
The bottom arm of the cross
The left arm of the cross
The right arm of the cross

questions.explanation: In a cross-shaped net, the center square’s opposite face is the square at the bottom of the cross when folded.

questions.text: A 4x4 grid has a pattern where every second cell in each row is shaded, starting with the second cell. How many cells are shaded?
questions.explanation: Each row has 4 cells, with cells 2 and 4 shaded (2 per row). With 4 rows, total shaded cells = 2 × 4 = 8.

questions.text: If a hexagon is rotated 60 degrees clockwise, what happens to its vertices?
questions.explanation: A hexagon has 6 vertices, and a 60-degree rotation (360 ÷ 6) moves each vertex to the next position clockwise.

questions.text: A cube has a green dot on its front face and is rolled right once, then backward once. Where is the green dot?
questions.explanation: Rolling right moves the front to the left, and rolling backward moves the left to the back, so the green dot is on the back face.

questions.text: Which shape completes the pattern: pentagon, hexagon, heptagon, pentagon, hexagon, __?
questions.explanation: The pattern repeats every three shapes: pentagon, hexagon, heptagon. After pentagon, hexagon, the next is heptagon.

questions.text: A 3x3 grid has a pattern where the border cells are black and the center cell is white. How many black cells are there?
questions.explanation: The border of a 3x3 grid includes all cells except the center: 3 (top) + 2 (middle sides) + 3 (bottom) = 8 black cells.

questions.text: A flat sheet is folded into a cylinder. How many edges does the resulting shape have?
questions.explanation: A cylinder has two circular edges (top and bottom) formed by folding a rectangular sheet along one dimension.

questions.text: A square is reflected over its horizontal axis. What happens to its top-left corner?
questions.explanation: Reflecting a square over its horizontal axis flips it vertically, so the top-left corner becomes the bottom-left corner.

questions.text: A 3x3 grid has a pattern where the first row is red, the second row is blue, and the third row is green. What color is the cell in the third row, second column?
questions.explanation: The third row is green, so the cell in the third row, second column is green.

questions.text: A cube is painted yellow on two adjacent faces. How many smaller cubes in a 2x2x2 cut would have exactly two faces painted yellow?
questions.explanation: In a 2x2x2 cube, the edge between two adjacent painted faces has 4 smaller cubes, each with two faces painted yellow.

questions.text: If a rectangle is rotated 90 degrees counterclockwise, what happens to its longer sides?

options.text: They swap with the shorter sides

questions.explanation: A 90-degree counterclockwise rotation turns horizontal longer sides into vertical ones.

questions.text: A 4x4 grid has a checkerboard pattern starting with a black cell in the top-left. How many black cells are there?
questions.explanation: A 4x4 grid has 16 cells. A checkerboard pattern alternates colors, with 8 black and 8 white cells.

questions.text: A flat net of a triangular pyramid (tetrahedron) has 4 triangles. If one triangle is shaded, how many faces of the folded tetrahedron are shaded?
questions.explanation: Shading one triangle in the net results in one face of the folded tetrahedron being shaded.

questions.text: A cube has a star on its top face and is rolled forward once, then left once. Where is the star?
questions.explanation: Rolling forward moves the star to the front, and rolling left moves it to a side face.
